seo.title: Financial Trauma & Monetary Psychotherapy | Financial Abuse Therapist — Dan Lobel
seo.description: Financial trauma therapy in Melbourne for women. Heal money shame and anxiety with compassionate, trauma‑informed counselling and monetary psychotherapy. Safe, inclusive, gender‑aware care.

brand.name: Financial Abuse Therapist
brand.subtitle: Dan Lobel
brand.tagline: Trauma‑informed care with safety, dignity and choice.

hero.title: Reclaim Your Power. Heal Your Relationship With Money.
hero.subtitle: with Dan Lobel, D.Couns., B.Couns., MCouns&Psych
hero.description: Trauma-informed counselling for financial abuse recovery, economic stress, and nervous-system-aware money work.

about.title: Trauma‑Informed Financial Therapy
paragraphs: Dan is a warm, empathic counsellor who combines contemporary integrative counselling with behavioural psychology to help you understand the “why” behind your feelings and choices — particularly around money, self‑worth, grief, and life transitions.

Therapy is paced by you. Consent, choice, and clear boundaries are central. You will never be asked to disclose more than feels safe. Sessions focus on restoring a felt sense of safety, strengthening self‑trust, and supporting practical next steps at a pace that respects your nervous system.

Drawing on monetary psychotherapy alongside integrative, evidence‑based modalities, Dan supports the emotional, relational, and practical dimensions of financial stress — helping you reconnect with agency, dignity, and hope.

valueProps.title: Consent-led therapy
valueProps.description: Every conversation is paced by your nervous system. Disclosure is always optional and collaborative.

valueProps.title: Money + emotions together
valueProps.description: We pair nervous-system safety with practical money rituals so the numbers feel less overwhelming.

valueProps.title: Support between sessions
valueProps.description: Access guided check-ins, worksheets, and email reflections to keep momentum when sessions pause.

testimonials.quote: Dan’s presence is calm and respectful. I felt safe naming money shame for the first time.
testimonials.author: Amelia

testimonials.quote: Sessions helped me rebuild self-trust and make decisions from care, not fear.
testimonials.author: Priya

testimonials.quote: We moved at a pace my body could handle. The mix of practicality and kindness was exactly what I needed.
testimonials.author: Grace

faqs.question: Can I start with Telehealth?
faqs.answer: Yes. Most clients begin online. You can shift to in-person or hybrid when it feels right.

faqs.question: Do I need to bring financial documents?
faqs.answer: No. We focus on how money feels emotionally. Bring numbers only if it helps you feel grounded.

faqs.question: Is this therapy appropriate if I’m still experiencing coercion?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. We prioritise safety planning and can liaise with other supports, with your consent.

leadMagnet.heading: Need a gentle starting point?
leadMagnet.body: Download the 5-step Financial Safety Check-in used in session to calm your system before money admin.
leadMagnet.helper: Requesting the guide acknowledges the consent statement in our client agreement.
